intro: Peristylus stenodon, commonly known as the narrow-toothed peristylus, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Peristylus stenodon is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
